FuncDef: The reset traffic-statistics suppression vsi command clears the traffic suppression statistics.
CLIs: reset traffic-statistics suppression vsi name <vsi-name> [ peer <peer-address> [ [ negotiation-vc-id <negotiation-vc-id> ] | [ remote-site <rmtSiteId> ] | ldp129 ] | uni ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the peer IP address for a PW whose traffic suppression statistics are to be cleared.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the negotiation VC ID for a PW whose traffic suppression statistics are to be cleared.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Remote site ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65534.

Clears the traffic suppression statistics of LDP FEC 129 PW.
-

Specifies the negotiation VSI AC whose traffic suppression statistics are to be cleared.
-

Specifies the VSI name for a PW whose traffic suppression statistics are to be cleared.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset traffic-statistics suppression vsi name vsi1 peer 2.2.2.2
<HUAWEI> reset traffic-statistics suppression vsi name yf uni
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The system starts to collect PW traffic suppression statistics after traffic suppression is enabled for the PW. To clear the traffic suppression statistics, run the reset traffic-statistics suppression vsi command. To view PW traffic suppression statistics collected during a specified period for network monitoring or troubleshooting, use the display traffic-statistics vsi and reset traffic-statistics suppression vsi commands together.
Configuration Impact
After the reset traffic-statistics suppression vsi command is run on a device, the device clears the existing PW traffic suppression statistics and performs another collection.
